TempGuard Tutorial
TempGuard is a web application that allows users to monitor temperatures in critical environments via sensors from a browser.
Monitoring temperature controlled environments is critical for many businesses.
Temperatures are monitored by low voltage probes wired to a receiver which is connected to your network.
In this demonstration however we will be simulating the live temperature fluctuations so that no hardware is necessary.
Each sensor is customizable allowing for valid temperature ranges. If a sensor reads a temperature outside a given range it will go into alarm mode.
If a sensor enters alarm mode it can send a warning email or SMS text to users that are setup in the settings page.
Getting notifications when refrigeration equipment malfunctions helps avoid crisis and can save inventory from being damaged or lossed.
The Dashboard displays your sensors and important information. This is where you can add/edit/remove sensors.
The History page displays historical data in a line chart for a selected sensor. Seeing patterns in temperature fluctuations can be very useful to determine issues and prompt corrective action.
The settings page is where you enter your company information and setup users for receiving alerts.
Lastly, if you are in need of support please visit the support page for our contact information.

Thank you for using TempGuard!
